snippet.title: Bull kills teen WA farm worker
snippet.content: A WOMAN has been killed by a bull while working on a farm in Dalyup, about 680km south-east of Perth. The woman was located unresponsive by a co-worker at the South Coast Highway farm at about 11.35am on Monday. Police believe the 19-year-old woman had been herding a bull when she was struck by the animal and pushed into a fence railing. St John Ambulance took the woman to Esperance Hospital but she could not be revived. Worksafe will be investigate the circumstances surrounding the death and a report will be prepared for the coroner.
